title: Boltswagen - das bolts.
description: The Boltswagen crew shows off spots and skills around their hometown of Montréal, Québec. There's a few NYC clips sprinkled in for good measure.

title: Adidas - Broadway Bullet
description: "adidas Skateboarding takes on the streets of New York City - a metropolis that helped shape the golden era of skateboarding. Channeling the raw energy and grit of the city, 'Broadway Bullet' brings the global team together to skate spots across Manhattan and beyond, while officially introducing two new faces - Nora Vasconcellos and Frankie Spears. "

title: North
description: North, A Skateboard video by Antisocial skate shop, World Industries and Circa. Canadian parts from Arron Johnson, Mike Chalmers, Keegan Sauder, Wade Fyfe, Russ Milligan, Mike McDermott, Ted de Gros and a bunch more. VHS and DVD releases.

title: Flip - Extremely Sorry
description: "It's really real. Five long years in the making, "Extremely Sorry" is the third release in Flip's Sorry trilogy of skateboarding insanity. The world famous Flip team continues to evolve with the addition of new talented riders joining the original crew, creating one of the most diverse skate teams in modern history. Famous not only for their insane skateboarding skills, the Flip team are also notorious for their renegade lifestyles -- so don't expect to see them at the Olympics any time soon! Extremely Sorry was so named to be a tongue-in-cheek mockery of the mainstream contest side of skateboarding. Enjoy!"

title: Dan Wolfe - Closure
description: "Closure is a retrospective skate video by Dan Wolfe covering ten years (1993-2003) of street skating. The video contains the best footage from various skate videos Dan has worked on (Underachievers, Third Eye View, World Tour, Real to Reel, etc) and also contains never before seen footage from throughout the years. In addition, there's an entirely new part at the end of the video."

title: DC - The DC Video
description: "Over three years in making, The DC Video features the talents of one of the most dynamic teams in skateboarding. Individually, DC's skaters have a staggering impact on the sport. Now for the first time, their diverse talents come together for DC's first ever skateboarding video. Filmed on location around the world, including Los Angeles, San Francisco, Philadelphia, Vancouver, Europe, and Australia. The DC Video also features the DC Super Ramp and introduces the revolutionary DC Mega Ramp."

title: Thank You - Torey Pudwill's "Bigger Bang" Part
description: "The first Big Bang changed the course of skate parts forever. Now, after millions of views and a decade of broken bones and bangers, our guy does it again. Thank you, Torey." -Thrasher Magazine

title: Skate Tales - Meet One Of The Pioneers Of Street Skateboarding Mike Vallely (S2E6)
description:
In truth, we probably haven’t got enough bandwidth to do the twists and turns of Mike Vallely’s skateboarding life story justice, so let us perhaps instead consider some of the many roles he has played in order to provide some context as to what makes him such an enduring enigma.

There are worse places to start charting his cultural ascent within skateboarding than his breakout section from Powell Peralta’s game-changing 1988 video release Public Domain. Skateboarding was changing daily at that point with the genesis of street skating and Mike V’s East Coast aesthetic and floppy-wristed silhouette caught the attention of an entire skateboarding world that had realised that there was more to this culture than hero-worshipping the MTV- generation of sleeveless T-shirted Californian vert professionals who were appearing more dated and anachronistic by the day.

His double-kick Barnyard board for World Industries effectively signaled a new era in skateboarding trick development which Salman Agah would later pioneer and effectively treble the skateboarding trick lexicon by adding nollie and switchstance possibilities to every trick hitherto utilizing the ollie alone.

Despite being on a tangent to what the skateboarding mainstream was doing, Vallely was still an enticing prospect to sponsors precisely because he has always had his own constituency within skateboarding: 120,000 Mexicans turned out to watch him put on a one-man skate demo in 2008.

Accordingly, he would ride for brands like Powell, Black Label and Element Skateboards when each of those brands were at the peak of their powers before finally starting his own Street Plant label in 2015 while somehow finding time along the way to front the re-formed punk band Black Flag and have stints in both semi- professional wrestling and ice hockey.

Now settled with his family in Des Moines, Iowa he has enjoyed a 35-year pro skating career on his own terms. There are no other Mike Vallely’s.

Madars Apse hits the streets with a true original to learn about Street Plant, punk rock and the journey of a street scoundrel from New Jersey.

title: D.R.E.A.M.

title: Powell Peralta - The Search For Animal Chin
description: Bones Brigade video #3. Filmed during 1986 and premiered at an old closed movie theater in Santa Monica. Features the famous Animal Chin ramp and the incredible vert sequence that took place there.

title: Santa Cruz - Misprints
description:
We proudly introduce our newest video ‘MISPRINTS’ Starring Tom Asta, Maurio McCoy, Kevin Braun & Introducing Devin Flynn.

With a focus on their east coast and midwest routes the crew traveled between Philadelphia, New York, Nashville and more over the last year.

Camera work by Nick Hanson, Harry Bergenfield, and Joe Perrin.
